verse.roman:
dharmas tu haihaya-suto
netraḥ kunteḥ pitā tataḥ
sohañjir abhavat kunter
mahiṣmān bhadrasenakaḥ

synonyms: dharmaḥ tu—Dharma, however; haihaya-sutaḥ—became the son of Haihaya; netraḥ—Netra; kunteḥ—of Kunti; pitā—the father; tataḥ—from him (Dharma); sohañjiḥ—Sohañji; abhavat—became; kunteḥ—the son of Kunti; mahiṣmān—Mahiṣmān; bhadrasenakaḥ—Bhadrasenaka.
translation: The son of Haihaya was Dharma, and the son of Dharma was Netra, the father of Kunti. From Kunti came a son named Sohañji, from Sohañji came Mahiṣmān, and from Mahiṣmān, Bhadrasenaka.
